Typealiases.html#/s:7Bluejay17RestoreIde.name: RestoreIdentifier
Typealiases.html#/s:7Bluejay17RestoreIde.abstract: An alias to make it clearer that the string should be some kind of identifier for restoration, and not just any arbitrary string.

Structs/CharacteristicIdentifier.html#/s.name: init(uuid:service:)
Structs/CharacteristicIdentifier.html#/s.abstract: Create a CharacteristicIdentifier using a string and a ServiceIdentifier. Please supply a valid 128-bit UUID, or a valid 16 or 32-bit commonly used UUID.

Structs/DataPadding.html#/s:7Bluejay11Da.name: toBluetoothData()
Structs/DataPadding.html#/s:7Bluejay11Da.abstract: This function is required to conform to the Sendable protocol, which allows Bluejay to serialize DataPadding when performing write-related operations.

Structs/StartOptions.html#/s:7Bluejay12S.name: default
Structs/StartOptions.html#/s:7Bluejay12S.abstract: Convenience factory method to avoid having to use the public initializer.

Structs/WarningOptions.html#/s:7Bluejay1.name: default
Structs/WarningOptions.html#/s:7Bluejay1.abstract: Sensible default warning options: all off in favour of not aggressively notifying the user of changes when the app is backgrounded.

Structs/WarningOptions.html#/s:7Bluejay1.name: init(notifyOnConnection:notifyOnDisconnection:notifyOnNotification:)
Structs/WarningOptions.html#/s:7Bluejay1.abstract: Creates a connection options that can specify whether iOS can display a system alert when certain conditions are met while your app is suspended, usually an alert dialog outside of your app in the Home screen for example.

Structs/ServiceIdentifier.html#/s:7Bluej.name: init(uuid:)
Structs/ServiceIdentifier.html#/s:7Bluej.abstract: Create a ServiceIdentifier using a string. Please supply a valid 128-bit UUID, or a valid 16 or 32-bit commonly used UUID.

Structs/ScanDiscovery.html#/s:7Bluejay13.name: peripheralIdentifier
Structs/ScanDiscovery.html#/s:7Bluejay13.abstract: The unique, persistent identifier associated with the peer.

Structs/ScanDiscovery.html#/s:7Bluejay13.name: advertisementPacket
Structs/ScanDiscovery.html#/s:7Bluejay13.abstract: The advertisement packet the discovered peripheral is sending.

Structs/ScanDiscovery.html#/s:7Bluejay13.name: rssi
Structs/ScanDiscovery.html#/s:7Bluejay13.abstract: The signal strength of the peripheral discovered.

Structs/ScanDiscovery.html.name: ScanDiscovery
Structs/ScanDiscovery.html.abstract: A model capturing what is found from a scan callback.

Structs/ServiceIdentifier.html.name: ServiceIdentifier
Structs/ServiceIdentifier.html.abstract: A wrapper for CBUUID specific to a service to help distinguish it from a CBUUID of a characteristic.

Structs/StartOptions.html.name: StartOptions
Structs/StartOptions.html.abstract: Wrapper for CBCentralManager initialization configurations when starting a new Bluejay instance.

Structs/DataPadding.html.name: DataPadding
Structs/DataPadding.html.abstract: Helper object that can create empty data to be used as padding in packet construction.

Structs/CharacteristicIdentifier.html.name: CharacteristicIdentifier
Structs/CharacteristicIdentifier.html.abstract: A wrapper for CBUUID specific to a characteristic to help distinguish it from a CBUUID of a service.

Structs/PeripheralIdentifier.html.name: PeripheralIdentifier
Structs/PeripheralIdentifier.html.abstract: Uniquely identifies a peripheral to the current iOS device. The UUID changes and is different on different iOS devices.

Protocols/ConnectionObserver.html#/s:7Bl.name: bluetoothAvailable(_:)
Protocols/ConnectionObserver.html#/s:7Bl.abstract: Called whenever Bluetooth availability changes, as well as when an object first subscribes to become a ConnectionObserver.

Protocols/ConnectionObserver.html#/s:7Bl.name: connected(to:)
Protocols/ConnectionObserver.html#/s:7Bl.abstract: Called whenever a peripheral is connected, as well as when an object first subscribes to become a ConnectionObserver and the peripheral is already connected.

Protocols/Sendable.html#/s:7Bluejay8Send.name: toBluetoothData()
Protocols/Sendable.html#/s:7Bluejay8Send.abstract: A place to implement your serialization logic.

Protocols/Receivable.html#/s:7Bluejay10R.name: init(bluetoothData:)
Protocols/Receivable.html#/s:7Bluejay10R.abstract: A place to implement your deserialization logic.

Protocols/RSSIObserver.html#/s:7Bluejay1.name: peripheral(_:didReadRSSI:error:)
Protocols/RSSIObserver.html#/s:7Bluejay1.abstract: Called whenever a peripheral’s RSSI value changes.

Protocols/DisconnectHandler.html#/s:7Blu.name: didDisconnect(from:with:willReconnect:)
Protocols/DisconnectHandler.html#/s:7Blu.abstract: Notifies the delegate that the peripheral is fully disconnected.

Protocols/ListenRestorer.html#/s:7Blueja.name: willRestoreListen(on:)
Protocols/ListenRestorer.html#/s:7Blueja.abstract: Notify the conforming class that there is a characteristic being listened on, but it doesn’t have any listen callbacks.

Protocols/ListenRestorer.html.name: ListenRestorer
Protocols/ListenRestorer.html.abstract: A class protocol allowing notification of a characteristic being listened on, and provides an opportunity to restore its listen callback during Bluetooth state restoration.

Protocols/DisconnectHandler.html.name: DisconnectHandler
Protocols/DisconnectHandler.html.abstract: A protocol allowing a single delegate registered to Bluejay to have a final say at the end of a disconnection, as well as evaluate and control the auto-reconnect behaviour.

Protocols/RSSIObserver.html.name: RSSIObserver
Protocols/RSSIObserver.html.abstract: A protocol allowing conforming objects to monitor the RSSI changes of a connected peripheral.

Protocols/Receivable.html.name: Receivable
Protocols/Receivable.html.abstract: Protocol to indicate that a type can be received from the Bluetooth connection.

Protocols/Sendable.html.name: Sendable
Protocols/Sendable.html.abstract: Protocol to indicate that a type can be sent via the Bluetooth connection.

Protocols/ConnectionObserver.html.name: ConnectionObserver
Protocols/ConnectionObserver.html.abstract: A protocol allowing conforming objects registered to Bluejay to optionally respond to Bluetooth connection events.

Extensions/CBPeripheralState.html#/s:So1.name: string()
Extensions/CBPeripheralState.html#/s:So1.abstract: Returns the name of a CBPeripheralState as a string.

Extensions/Data.html#/s:10Foundation4Dat.name: extract(start:length:)
Extensions/Data.html#/s:10Foundation4Dat.abstract: Convenience function to read a range of Data and deserialize it into the specified type.

Extensions/Data.html#/s:10Foundation4Dat.name: toBluetoothData()
Extensions/Data.html#/s:10Foundation4Dat.abstract: Allows using Data as is when using Bluejay and working with write-related operations.

Extensions/Data.html#/s:10Foundation4Dat.name: init(bluetoothData:)
Extensions/Data.html#/s:10Foundation4Dat.abstract: Allows using Data as is when using Bluejay and working with read-related operations.

Extensions/CBManagerState.html#/s:So14CB.name: string()
Extensions/CBManagerState.html#/s:So14CB.abstract: Returns the name of a CBManagerState as a string.

Extensions/CBService.html#/s:So9CBServic.name: characteristic(with:)
Extensions/CBService.html#/s:So9CBServic.abstract: Find a characteristic on a service by CBUUID.

Extensions/CBPeripheral.html#/s:So12CBPe.name: service(with:)
Extensions/CBPeripheral.html#/s:So12CBPe.abstract: Find a service on a peripheral by CBUUID.

Extensions/BinaryInteger.html#/s:Sz7Blue.name: toBluetoothData()
Extensions/BinaryInteger.html#/s:Sz7Blue.abstract: This function is required to conform to Sendable, and figures out the size of the Integer used by the iOS device.

Extensions/BinaryInteger.html#/s:Sz7Blue.name: init(bluetoothData:)
Extensions/BinaryInteger.html#/s:Sz7Blue.abstract: This function is required to conform to Receivable, and figures out the size of the Integer used by the iOS device.

Extensions/BinaryInteger.html.name: BinaryInteger
Extensions/BinaryInteger.html.abstract: Extension to Int to make it Sendable and Receivable.

Enums/RunResult.html#/s:7Bluejay9RunResu.name: success(_:)
Enums/RunResult.html#/s:7Bluejay9RunResu.abstract: The background task is successful, and the returned value is captured in the associated value.

Enums/RunResult.html#/s:7Bluejay9RunResu.name: failure(_:)
Enums/RunResult.html#/s:7Bluejay9RunResu.abstract: The background task has failed unexpectedly with an error.

Enums/Timeout.html#/s:7Bluejay7TimeoutO7.name: seconds(_:)
Enums/Timeout.html#/s:7Bluejay7TimeoutO7.abstract: Specify a timeout with a duration in seconds.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: bluetoothUnavailable
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: Bluetooth is either turned off or unavailable.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: multipleScanNotSupported
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: Bluejay does not support another scanning request if Bluejay is still scanning.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: multipleConnectNotSupported
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: Bluejay does not support another connection request if Bluejay is already connected or still connecting.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: multipleDisconnectNotSupported
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: Bluejay does not support another disconnection request if Bluejay is still disconnecting.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: connectionTimedOut
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: A connection request in Bluejay has timed out.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: notConnected
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: Bluejay is not connected to a peripheral.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: missingService(_:)
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: A Bluetooth service is not found.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: missingCharacteristic(_:)
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: A Bluetooth characteristic is not found.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: cancelled
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: A Bluetooth operation is cancelled.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: explicitDisconnect
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: Bluejay disconnect is called.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: disconnectQueued
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: A disconnection operation is queued.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: listenTimedOut
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: An attempt to listen on a characteristic has timed out.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: readFailed
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: An attempt to read a characteristic has failed.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: writeFailed
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: An attempt to write a characteristic has failed.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: missingData
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: An attempt to read a value from a characteristic has returned no data unexpectedly.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: dataOutOfBounds(start:length:count:)
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: An attempt to read a range of data has failed due to incorrect bounds or an unexpected length.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: unexpectedPeripheral(_:)
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: An unexpected peripheral is cached and retrieved from CoreBluetooth.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: scanningWithAllowDuplicatesInBackgroundNotSupported
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: iOS will not continue scanning in the background if allow duplicates is turned on.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: missingServiceIdentifiersInBackground
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: iOS will not continue scanning in the background if no service identifiers are specified.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: backgroundTaskRunning
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: Bluejay does not support further Bluetooth operations while a Bluejay background task is still running.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: multipleBackgroundTaskNotSupported
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: Bluejay does not support another Bluejay background task when there is already one that is still running.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: listenCacheEncoding(_:)
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: Bluejay has failed to encode a listen cache.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: listenCacheDecoding(_:)
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: Bluejay has failed to decode a listen cache.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: indefiniteFlush
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: Indefinite flush will not exit.

Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.name: stopped
Enums/BluejayError.html#/s:7Bluejay0A5Er.abstract: Bluejay has stopped.

Enums/WriteResult.html#/s:7Bluejay11Writ.name: failure(_:)
Enums/WriteResult.html#/s:7Bluejay11Writ.abstract: The write has failed unexpectedly with an error.

Enums/AutoReconnectMode.html#/s:7Bluejay.name: noChange
Enums/AutoReconnectMode.html#/s:7Bluejay.abstract: Bluejay will maintain its current auto-reconnect behaviour.

Enums/ConnectionResult.html#/s:7Bluejay1.name: success(_:)
Enums/ConnectionResult.html#/s:7Bluejay1.abstract: The connection is successful, and the peripheral connected is captured in the associated value.

Enums/ConnectionResult.html#/s:7Bluejay1.name: failure(_:)
Enums/ConnectionResult.html#/s:7Bluejay1.abstract: The connection has failed unexpectedly with an error.

Enums/ScanAction.html#/s:7Bluejay10ScanA.name: blacklist
Enums/ScanAction.html#/s:7Bluejay10ScanA.abstract: Continue scanning, but don’t discover the same peripheral in the current callback again within the same scan session.

Enums/ScanAction.html#/s:7Bluejay10ScanA.name: connect(_:_:_:_:)
Enums/ScanAction.html#/s:7Bluejay10ScanA.abstract: Stop scanning, and connect to a discovery.

Enums/DisconnectionResult.html#/s:7Bluej.name: disconnected(_:)
Enums/DisconnectionResult.html#/s:7Bluej.abstract: The disconnection is successful, and the disconnected peripheral is captured in the associated value.

Enums/DisconnectionResult.html#/s:7Bluej.name: failure(_:)
Enums/DisconnectionResult.html#/s:7Bluej.abstract: The disconnection has failed unexpectedly with an error.

Enums/BackgroundRestoreMode.html#/s:7Blu.name: disable
Enums/BackgroundRestoreMode.html#/s:7Blu.abstract: Bluejay will not receieve state restoration callbacks from CoreBluetooth.

Enums/BackgroundRestoreMode.html#/s:7Blu.name: enable(_:)
Enums/BackgroundRestoreMode.html#/s:7Blu.abstract: Bluejay will receive state restoration callbacks from CoreBluetooth.

Enums/BackgroundRestoreMode.html#/s:7Blu.name: enableWithListenRestorer(_:_:)
Enums/BackgroundRestoreMode.html#/s:7Blu.abstract: Bluejay will receive state restoration callbacks from CoreBluetooth and attempt to restore listens when necessary using the provided listen restorer.

Enums/ReadResult.html#/s:7Bluejay10ReadR.name: success(_:)
Enums/ReadResult.html#/s:7Bluejay10ReadR.abstract: The read is successful and the value read is captured in the associated value.

Enums/ReadResult.html#/s:7Bluejay10ReadR.name: failure(_:)
Enums/ReadResult.html#/s:7Bluejay10ReadR.abstract: The read has failed unexpectedly with an error.

Enums/ReadResult.html.name: ReadResult
Enums/ReadResult.html.abstract: Indicates a successful, cancelled, or failed read attempt, where the success case contains the value read.

Enums/BackgroundRestoreMode.html.name: BackgroundRestoreMode
Enums/BackgroundRestoreMode.html.abstract: Determines how Bluejay should opt-in to CoreBluetooth state restoration.

Enums/DisconnectionResult.html.name: DisconnectionResult
Enums/DisconnectionResult.html.abstract: Indicates a successful, cancelled, or failed disconnection attempt, where the success case contains the peripheral disconnected from.

Enums/ScanAction.html.name: ScanAction
Enums/ScanAction.html.abstract: Indicates whether a scan should continue, continue but blacklist the current discovery, stop, or stop and connect.

Enums/ConnectionResult.html.name: ConnectionResult
Enums/ConnectionResult.html.abstract: Indicates a successful, cancelled, or failed connection attempt, where the success case contains the peripheral connected to.

Enums/WriteResult.html.name: WriteResult
Enums/WriteResult.html.abstract: Indicates a successful, cancelled, or failed write attempt.

Enums/StartMode.html.name: StartMode
Enums/StartMode.html.abstract: Specifies whether to start a new Bluejay instance from scratch, or from an existing CoreBluetooth session.

Enums/ListenAction.html.name: ListenAction
Enums/ListenAction.html.abstract: Indicates whether the current listen on a characteristic should continue or end.

Enums/Timeout.html.name: Timeout
Enums/Timeout.html.abstract: Types of connection time outs. Can specify a time out in seconds, or no time out.

Enums/RunResult.html.name: RunResult
Enums/RunResult.html.abstract: Indicates a successful, cancelled, or failed run(backgroundTask:completionOnMainThread:) attempt, where the success case contains the value returned at the end of the background task.

Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:7.name: read(from:)
Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:7.abstract: Read a value from the specified characteristic synchronously.

Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:7.name: write(to:value:type:)
Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:7.abstract: Write a value from the specified characteristic synchronously.

Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:7.name: writeAndRead(writeTo:value:type:readFrom:)
Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:7.abstract: Write to one characterestic then reading a value from another.

Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:7.name: listen(to:timeout:completion:)
Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:7.abstract: Listen for changes on a specified characterstic synchronously.

Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:7.name: flushListen(to:nonZeroTimeout:completion:)
Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:7.abstract: Flush a listen to a characteristic by receiving and discarding values for the specified duration.

Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:7.name: writeAndListen(writeTo:value:type:listenTo:timeoutInSeconds:completion:)
Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:7.abstract: Handle a compound operation consisting of writing on one characterstic followed by listening on another for some streamed data.

Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:7.name: writeAndAssemble(writeTo:value:listenTo:expectedLength:timeoutInSeconds:completion:)
Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:7.abstract: Similar to writeAndListen, but use this if you don’t know or don’t have control over how many packets will be sent to you. You still need to know the total size of the data you’re receiving.

Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:7.name: maximumWriteValueLength(for:)
Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:7.abstract: Ask for the peripheral’s maximum payload length in bytes for a single write request.

Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:7Bluejay10Per.name: readRSSI()
Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:7Bluejay10Per.abstract: Requests the current RSSI value from the peripheral, and the value is returned via the RSSIObserver delegation.

Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:7Bluejay10Per.name: register(observer:)
Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:7Bluejay10Per.abstract: Register a RSSI observer that can receive the RSSI value when readRSSI is called.

Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:7Bluejay10Per.name: isListening(to:)
Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:7Bluejay10Per.abstract: Checks whether Bluejay is currently listening to the specified charactersitic.

Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:7Bluejay10Per.name: listen(to:completion:)
Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:7Bluejay10Per.abstract: Listen for notifications on a specified characterstic.

Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:7Bluejay10Per.name: restoreListen(to:completion:)
Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:7Bluejay10Per.abstract: Restore a (believed to be) active listening session, so if we start up in response to a notification, we can receive it.

Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:7Bluejay10Per.name: maximumWriteValueLength(for:)
Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:7Bluejay10Per.abstract: Ask for the peripheral’s maximum payload length in bytes for a single write request.

Classes/Peripheral.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@o.name: peripheral(_:didDiscoverServices:)
Classes/Peripheral.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@o.abstract: Captures CoreBluetooth’s did discover services event and pass it to Bluejay’s queue for processing.

Classes/Peripheral.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@o.name: peripheral(_:didDiscoverCharacteristicsFor:error:)
Classes/Peripheral.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@o.abstract: Captures CoreBluetooth’s did discover characteristics event and pass it to Bluejay’s queue for processing.

Classes/Peripheral.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@o.name: peripheral(_:didWriteValueFor:error:)
Classes/Peripheral.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@o.abstract: Captures CoreBluetooth’s did write to charactersitic event and pass it to Bluejay’s queue for processing.

Classes/Peripheral.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@o.name: peripheral(_:didUpdateValueFor:error:)
Classes/Peripheral.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@o.abstract: Captures CoreBluetooth’s did receive a notification/value from a characteristic event and pass it to Bluejay’s queue for processing.

Classes/Peripheral.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@o.name: peripheral(_:didUpdateNotificationStateFor:error:)
Classes/Peripheral.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@o.abstract: Captures CoreBluetooth’s did turn on or off notification/listening on a characteristic event and pass it to Bluejay’s queue for processing.

Classes/Peripheral.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@o.name: peripheral(_:didReadRSSI:error:)
Classes/Peripheral.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@o.abstract: Captures CoreBluetooth’s did read RSSI event and pass it to Bluejay’s queue for processing.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC4uuid.name: uuid
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC4uuid.abstract: Helps distinguish one Bluejay instance from another.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC20isB.name: isBluetoothAvailable
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC20isB.abstract: Allows checking whether Bluetooth is powered on. Also returns false if Bluejay is not started yet.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC30isB.name: isBluetoothStateUpdateImminent
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC30isB.abstract: Allows checking for if CoreBluetooth state is transitional (update is imminent)

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC12isC.name: isConnecting
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC12isC.abstract: Allows checking whether Bluejay is currently connecting to a peripheral.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC11isC.name: isConnected
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC11isC.abstract: Allows checking whether Bluejay is currently connected to a peripheral.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC15isD.name: isDisconnecting
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC15isD.abstract: Allows checking whether Bluejay is currently disconnecting from a peripheral.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC19sho.name: shouldAutoReconnect
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC19sho.abstract: Allowing checking whether Bluejay will automatic reconnect after an unexpected disconnection. Default is true, and Bluejay will also always set this to true on a successful connection to a peripheral. Conversely, Bluejay will always set this to false after an explicit disconnection request.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC10isS.name: isScanning
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC10isS.abstract: Allows checking whether Bluejay is currently scanning.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC10has.name: hasStarted
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC10has.abstract: Allows checking whether Bluejay has started and is available for use.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC21def.name: defaultWarningOptions
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC21def.abstract: Warning options to use for each new connection if the options are not specified at the creation of those connections.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/c:@M@Bluejay@objc(.name: init()
Classes/Bluejay.html#/c:@M@Bluejay@objc(.abstract: Initializing a Bluejay instance will not yet initialize the CoreBluetooth stack. An explicit start call after Bluejay is intialized will then initialize the CoreBluetooth stack and is required because in cases where a state resotration is trying to restore a listen on a characteristic, a listen restorer must be available before the CoreBluetooth stack is re-initialized. This two-step startup allows you to prepare and gaurantee the setup of your listen restorer in between the initialization of Bluejay and the initialization of the CoreBluetooth stack.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC5star.name: start(mode:connectionObserver:disconnectHandler:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC5star.abstract: Starting Bluejay will initialize the CoreBluetooth stack. Simply initializing a Bluejay instance without calling this function will not initialize the CoreBluetooth stack. An explicit start call is required because in cases where a state resotration is trying to restore a listen on a characteristic, a listen restorer must be available before the CoreBluetooth stack is re-initialized. This two-step startup (init then start) allows you to prepare and gaurantee the setup of your listen restorer in between the initialization of Bluejay and the initialization of the CoreBluetooth stack.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC28sto.name: stopAndExtractBluetoothState()
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC28sto.abstract: Stops all operations and clears all states in Bluejay before returning a Core Bluetooth state that can then be used by another library or code outside of Bluejay.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC16can.name: cancelEverything(error:shouldDisconnect:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC16can.abstract: This will cancel the current and all pending operations in the Bluejay queue. It will also disconnect by default after the queue is emptied, but you can cancel everything without disconnecting.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC17cle.name: clearListenCaches()
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC17cle.abstract: This will remove any cached listens associated with the receiving Bluejay’s restore identifier. Call this if you want to stop Bluejay from attempting to restore any listens when state restoration occurs.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC8regi.name: register(observer:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC8regi.abstract: Register for notifications on Bluetooth connection events and state changes. Unregistering is not required, Bluejay will unregister for you if the observer is no longer in memory.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC10unr.name: unregister(observer:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC10unr.abstract: Unregister for notifications on Bluetooth connection events and state changes. Unregistering is not required, Bluejay will unregister for you if the observer is no longer in memory.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC25reg.name: registerDisconnectHandler(handler:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC25reg.abstract: Register a single disconnection handler for giving it a final say on what to do at the end of a disconnection, as well as evaluate and control Bluejay’s auto-reconnect behaviour.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC12sto.name: stopScanning()
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC12sto.abstract: Stops an ongoing scan if there is one, otherwise it does nothing.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC7conn.name: connect(_:timeout:warningOptions:completion:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC7conn.abstract: Attempt to connect directly to a known peripheral. The call will fail if Bluetooth is not available, or if Bluejay is already connected. Making a connection request while Bluejay is scanning will also cause Bluejay to stop the current scan for you behind the scene prior to fulfilling your connection request.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC10dis.name: disconnect(immediate:completion:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC10dis.abstract: Disconnect a connected peripheral or cancel a connecting peripheral.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC6list.name: listen(to:completion:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC6list.abstract: Listen for notifications on the specified characteristic.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC13res.name: restoreListen(to:completion:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC13res.abstract: Restore a (believed to be) active listening session, so if we start up in response to a notification, we can receive it.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC11isL.name: isListening(to:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC11isL.abstract: Check if a peripheral is listening to a specific characteristic.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC3run1.name: run(backgroundTask:completionOnMainThread:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC3run1.abstract: One of the three ways to run a background task using a synchronous interface to the Bluetooth peripheral. This is the simplest one as the background task will not return any typed values back to the completion block on finishing the background task, except for thrown errors, and it also doesn’t provide an input for an object that might need thread safe access.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC3run1.name: run(backgroundTask:completionOnMainThread:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC3run1.abstract: One of the three ways to run a background task using a synchronous interface to the Bluetooth peripheral. This one allows the background task to potentially return a typed value back to the completion block on finishing the background task successfully.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC3run8.name: run(userData:backgroundTask:completionOnMainThread:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC3run8.abstract: One of the three ways to run a background task using a synchronous interface to the Bluetooth peripheral. This one allows the background task to potentially return a typed value back to the completion block on finishing the background task successfully, as well as supplying an object for thread safe access inside the background task.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC7comb.name: combine(sendables:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:7BluejayAAC7comb.abstract: A helper function to take an array of Sendables and combine their data together.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@objc.name: centralManagerDidUpdateState(_:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@objc.abstract: Bluejay uses this to figure out whether Bluetooth is available or not.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@objc.name: centralManager(_:willRestoreState:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@objc.abstract: If Core Bluetooth will restore state, update Bluejay’s internal states to match the states of the Core Bluetooth stack by assigning the peripheral to connectingPeripheral or connectedPeripheral, or niling them out, depending on what the restored CBPeripheral state is.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@objc.name: centralManager(_:didConnect:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@objc.abstract: When connected, update Bluejay’s states by updating the values for connectingPeripheral, connectedPeripheral, and shouldAutoReconnect. Also, make sure to broadcast the event to observers, and notify the queue so that the current operation in-flight can process this event and get a chance to finish.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@objc.name: centralManager(_:didDisconnectPeripheral:error:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@objc.abstract: Handle a disconnection event from Core Bluetooth by figuring out what kind of disconnection it is (planned or unplanned), and updating Bluejay’s internal state and sending notifications as appropriate.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@objc.name: centralManager(_:didFailToConnect:error:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@objc.abstract: This mostly happens when either the Bluetooth device or the Core Bluetooth stack somehow only partially completes the negotiation of a connection. For simplicity, Bluejay is currently treating this as a disconnection event, so it can perform all the same clean up logic.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@objc.name: centralManager(_:didDiscover:advertisementData:rssi:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/c:@CM@Bluejay@objc.abstract: This should only be called when the current operation in the queue is a Scan task.

Classes/Bluejay.html.name: Bluejay
Classes/Bluejay.html.abstract: Bluejay is a simple wrapper around CoreBluetooth that focuses on making a common usage case as straight forward as possible: a single connected peripheral that the user is interacting with regularly (think most personal electronics devices that have an associated iOS app: fitness trackers, guitar amps, etc).

Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html.name: SynchronizedPeripheral
Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html.abstract: A synchronous interface to the Bluetooth peripheral, intended to be used inside the backgroundTask block of run(backgroundTask:completionOnMainThread:) to perform multi-part operations without the need for a complicated callback or promise setup.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
